definition: to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: The smart-aleck rookie detective got himself in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 这个自作聪明的菜鸟侦探让自己身陷危机。

sentences.english: The horror of the stupid is that they think themselves smart not for their stupidness.
sentences.chinese: 笨人的可怕不在其笨，而在其自作聪明。

sentences.english: Don’t try to offer brainy solutions.
sentences.chinese: 不要自作聪明地提供解决办法。

sentences.english: They get carried away with their own cleverness and build things that are overcomplicated.
sentences.chinese: 他们自作聪明地把事情过度复杂化。

sentences.english: Off court he was witty but never smart-alecky.
sentences.chinese: 在场下，他十分风趣机智但从不自作聪明。

definition: a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4

definition: to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
clever-clever/clever in trivial matters/sharp but petty-minded
to overreach oneself/to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face
to pass the misfortune on to sb else (idiom); to blame others/to pass the buck
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
